body: @bgchun Thanks! We will take this back to JIRA and design a proper fix.

Pinging @jsjason @bgchun @shravanmn as release manager of 0.12. This issue is considered a critical "blocking" issue.

From a quick look at the discussion, it looks like your move @shravanmn :)

I also created some JIRA sub-tasks under https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-364. Please feel free to comment on them. Thank you!
@jwang98052 I did a pass.
@motus can you have a look?

I just tested it, and the new tests fail:

```
Test Name:  TestEvaluatorConfigurations
Test FullName:  Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests.EvaluatorConfigurationsTests.TestEvaluatorConfigurations
Test Source:    c:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests\EvaluatorConfigurationsTests.cs : line 39

Result StandardOutput:  
Org.Apache.REEF.Common.Runtime.Evaluator.Utils.EvaluatorConfigurations Start: 0 : 2015-07-24T08:32:57.9825254-07:00 0017
START: 2015-07-24 08:32:57 EvaluatorConfigurations::EvaluatorConfigurations

```
@afchung is this PR still relevant? I got confused between this and the JIRAs :-)

> I haven't changed the "default"/"user" approach yet, in anticipation of more discussion.

The main reason to have default and user options seems to be backward compatibility. Hence, we could just deprecate the old ways and clean it up for 0.13?
Test issue fixed and review comments addressed and pushed in.
@jwang98052 Thanks, I will do another test run

@afchung This looks good. I just wonder how we know it is in fact working? And how do we make sure on an ongoing basis? If there is an easy test that can be written, we should add it before it gets merged.
-1 on merging this as the discussion  over on [JIRA](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-312) hasn't converged yet.
@jwang98052 Thanks, I will test and merge.

After clean, a `Release` build in Visual Studio fails with the following error log:

```
Error   19  Could not find file 'C:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests\Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests.nuspec'.   Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests
Error   20  The command ""C:\src\reef\lang\cs\.nuget\NuGet.exe" pack "C:\src\reef\lang\cs\\Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests\Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests.nuspec" -BasePath C:\src\reef\lang\cs\\Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests -Properties "Configuration=Release;Platform=x64;REEF_Version=0.12.0-incubating-SNAPSHOT;Version=0.12.0-SNAPSHOT-03" -NonInteractive -OutputDirectory "C:\src\reef\lang\cs\\.nuget\packages" " exited with code 1. Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests
```

A `Debug` build succeeded. Using the `Debug` build, the tests passed. 

Building the `Release` configuration from the command line using

```
msbuild $REEFSourcePath\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.sln /p:Configuration="Release" /p:Platform="x64" /m
```

Also fails:

```
 "c:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.sln" (default target) (1) ->
       "c:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests\Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests.csproj" (default target) (16) ->
       (BuildPackage target) ->
         c:\src\reef\lang\cs\.nuget\NuGet.targets(152,9): error : Could not find file 'c:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests\Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests.nuspec'. [c:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests\Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests.csproj]
         c:\src\reef\lang\cs\.nuget\NuGet.targets(152,9): error MSB3073: The command ""c:\src\reef\lang\cs\.nuget\NuGet.exe" pack "c:\src\reef\lang\cs\\Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests\Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests.nuspec" -BasePath c:\src\reef\lang\cs\\Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests -Properties "Configuration=Relea
       se;Platform=x64;REEF_Version=0.12.0-incubating-SNAPSHOT;Version=0.12.0-SNAPSHOT-03" -NonInteractive -OutputDirectory "c:\src\reef\lang\cs\\.nuget\packages" " exited with code 1. [c:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests\Org.Apache.REEF.Evaluator.Tests.csproj]
```

Hence, I believe this isn't just Visual Studio flakiness but a real issue.
Are there examples of tests that run on YARN?
Yes, we run all the tests in `reef-tests` on YARN clusters. The trick is that the tests can run on both YARN and Local. I suppose this won't work here?
We would have to inject a failure and either manually inspect on the cluster that the job failed as expected, or use the REST API to query for the results of the run on YARN.

@dafrista Thanks! The work was mostly automated by IntelliJ haha.
@markusweimer I'll test it on an HDInsight cluster tomorrow first.

@afchung I made a pass.

Most of the comments are about keeping final on the same line as the class/type. This might be a personal preference though. What do you think?

I had a couple comments on the less trivial changes as well.

Also, I have a question. Does checkstyle check local variables for `final` as well? The documentation seems to only talk about method parameters. Either way, this should shave some time off of future PR reviews :)
Done the squashing

@dkm2110 I've done a pass.

@afchung I did a review half-way through this change. I believe this should be split into at least two different PRs:
1. Move all the restart related configuration options out of `DriverConfiguration`
2. Replace the mechanism by which the driver persists the list of known evaluators with a configurable one. This is the stated goal of this PR.

Does this make sense?
I believe the issue is that the project indicates to create packages, which makes no sense for a test package. I'll try to fix it while merging.
I removed the import of the `nuget.targets` at the bottom of the project file. This fixed the issue. I'll test and merge.
@markusweimer Created REEF-514 for 1 above and merged REEF-85 with REEF-483 to REEF-483, since REEF-483 is more comprehensive. Will be sending out a PR shortly. Thanks!
